intro: Triodon angulatus, commonly known as the angular triodon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its angular, ridged stems and palmate leaves with three to five lobes. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often displaying shades of pink or white. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
